intro: Witheringia ruderalis, commonly known as the common weed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small yellow flowers. The plant is often found growing in disturbed soils, such as along roadsides and in fields, due to its adaptability to various environmental conditions. It has a short life cycle and reproduces through seeds that can remain viable in the soil for several years. Witheringia ruderalis is considered a pioneer species, playing a role in the early stages of ecological succession.
